intro: Ceropegia lugardiae, commonly known as the Cape mountain strewer, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It is characterized by its trailing stems and clusters of small, tubular flowers that are typically pale green to yellowish in color. The plant belongs to the family Apocynaceae and is known for its ability to thrive in arid and rocky environments. Its leaves are often succulent, adapted to store water, and it produces a milky sap that can be toxic. Ceropegia lugardiae is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its unique appearance and low maintenance requirements.
